page.title: 15Changes in Village Life
page.content: During the Second World War things began to change in Chapel Allerton.Food, clothing and sweets were rationed and little could be bought without coupons and money.Young men went off to war and women began to work on the farms.The houses had blackout curtains to keep out the light and everyone had a gas mask. About fifty children came from the cities to Chapel Allerton as evacuees. They joined the 20 children at the village school. After the war many young people went to live and work in the cities. Small farms were joined together and tractors and machinery were bought to help. Many people had cars and lived in Chapel Allerton while working in nearby towns and cities. The local school closed and the bus service to Weston was stopped. Now the only way to travel is by car.
